channel.title: CVE Feed for Artica PFMS -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Artica PFMS -- all products

item.title: CVE-2022-26309|2024-09-16T17:38:24.600Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: Pandora FMS v7.0NG.759 allows Cross-Site Request Forgery in Bulk operation (User operation) resulting in elevation of privilege to Administrator group.

item.title: CVE-2022-26310|2024-09-16T16:39:05.916Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: Pandora FMS v7.0NG.760 and below allows an improper authorization in User Management where any authenticated user with access to the User Management module could create, modify or delete any user with full admin privilege. The impact could lead to a vertical privilege escalation to access the privileges of a higher-level user or typically an admin user.

item.title: CVE-2022-1648|2024-09-16T19:47:11.391Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: Pandora FMS v7.0NG.760 and below allows a relative path traversal in File Manager where a privileged user could upload a .php file outside the intended images directory which is restricted to execute the .php file. The impact could lead to a Remote Code Execution with running application privilege.

item.title: CVE-2022-0507|2024-09-16T17:38:30.900Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: Found a potential security vulnerability inside the Pandora API. Affected Pandora FMS version range: all versions of NG version, up to OUM 759. This vulnerability could allow an attacker with authenticated IP to inject SQL.

item.title: CVE-2022-2032|2024-09-16T19:04:08.674Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: In Pandora FMS v7.0NG.761 and below, in the file manager section, the dirname parameter is vulnerable to a Stored Cross Site-Scripting. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker with administrator privileges logged in the system.

item.title: CVE-2022-2059|2024-09-16T19:40:15.388Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: In Pandora FMS v7.0NG.761 and below, in the agent creation section, the alias parameter is vulnerable to a Stored Cross Site-Scripting. This vulnerability can be exploited by an attacker with administrator privileges logged in the system.

item.title: CVE-2021-46676|2024-09-16T18:56:02.546Z -- artica%20pfms -- pandora%20fms
item.description: A XSS vulnerability exist in Pandora FMS version 756 and below, that allows an attacker to perform javascript code executions via the transactional maps name field.
